subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... JUnit will also reconstruct the test, not sure what you are getting at? -- Cédric [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
On 10/18/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/19/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> > I think we're talking about different things.
>
> Yes, we are.
>
> > The limitation you are talking about has nothing to do with JUnit or
> TestNG.
> > It's just harder to rerun a test method whose configuration has been
> > generated dynamically, whether it was done the JUnit way (added to the
> suite
> > programmatically) or the TestNG way (invoked with parameters).
> >
> > Or did I misunderstand what you are saying?
>
> It's not hard to do if you keep the test instance in JUnit. You simply
> tell it to run again. With TestNG, you need to reconstruct the test.


JUnit will also reconstruct the test, not sure what you are getting at?

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
